document.title: Encounters: Relationship in the Study and Teaching of Literature
document.abstract: While trends in the teaching of literature of the last few decades may seem at odds with one another, the thread that can weave them together is a recognition of relationship among readers, text, author, and other readers.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Cristina Vischer Bruns has taught composition at Saddleback Community College in Mission Viejo, California. She is pursuing an interdisciplinary Ph. D. in English and Education at the University of California, Santa Barbara. Her research explores the function of literary study and its implications for pedagogy at the college and university level.
